RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 1 5F Dirt CR: 86. Maiden Special Weight Purse 85000. (UP TO $15,300 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 118 lbs. (Non-starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred)(The First, Second and Third places finishers in this race shall have nomination, entry and starting fees waived for all Two-Year-Old Stakes at Saratoga Race Course.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PAYNES PRAIRIE had the pilot grab hold after ducking inward in an awkward at the break, recovered in short order and attained a prominent placing, was the outermost of a three way pace dispute on the turn, undertaking the role from the three path, began to edge away from the other two during the final jumps around the bend, responded positvely when given his cue to extend the advantage, finished comfortably in the clear, crossing the finish line being hand urged. ABBOT chased the fighting threesome from the two path on the turn, fanned outward entering the stretch until in the six path by the eighth pole, rallied willingly enough to garner the place although never posing a threat to the winner. READY DANCER contended for colmmand from between rivals on the turn, weakened steadily down the lane into the show slot. DALMORE came in sharply leaving the gate, bothering its next door neighbor enough to cause it to get steadied early, was along the rail arguing for control against two others parked out in paths two and three for most of the way to the quarter pole before giving way. THE GREAT WHITEWAY was steadied after getting carried in by DALMORE at the start, saved ground to the quarter pole, got placed three wide at the head of the stretch, had no offering.

ENTRY.NAME: The Great Whiteway
ENTRY.COMMENT: carried in & steadied brk,ins to 1/4,3w upper, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Dalmore
ENTRY.COMMENT: came in sharply break,aruged inside pair turn, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Ready Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied between rivals turn, weakened down lane

ENTRY.NAME: Paynes Prairie
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward st,3w vs pair turn,slim lead 1/4,drew off,hand urge wire

ENTRY.NAME: Abbot
ENTRY.COMMENT: chase trio 2p,fanned to 6p upper-midlane,closed well 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 90. Allowance Purse 90000. (UP TO $17,000 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $10,000 ONCE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A R ace Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 3 lbs. (Non-Starters for a claiming price of $25,000 or less in the last 3 starts preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBILANT VISION nestled amongst a tightly-packed group after the break, was taken back, proceeded down the backstretch put to firm hold by the rider, departed the it taking the three path, loosely drafted behind the runner up for a portion of the run around the bend before tipping out to be four wide coming to the five-sixteenths pole, entered the stretch and had the rider go to work, got hooked up a stirring duel with the ELRAAZY with the pair leaning on each shoulder to shoulder at times during this battle, appeared to beat the nemeis to the eighth pole by the barest of margins, went onward with gameness from there to win the bob. ELRAAZY sat perched three wide within striking distance of the pacesetter, was slightly closer to the rail heading home, got engaged in a stretch fight with the eventual winner, raced on nearly even terms with both combatants leaning upon each, lost the bob. PREDICATE rode the rail to the quarter pole, angled outward into the stretch having been put to strong urging, mustered up a mild kick for the show. MANAHATTA lightly bumped at the break, responded to some hand encouragement and shook free, set the splits from the two path, gave in to heavy pressure soon after spinning into the lane. MESHELL bumped lightly with MANAHATTA after losing its footing at the break, sneaked its way into the pocket nearing the end of the backstretch, faltered. DIAMOND EARRING raced between rivals on the turn, gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Predicate
ENTRY.COMMENT: rode rail,urged angling out into lane, mild kick for show

ENTRY.NAME: Manahatta
ENTRY.OWNER: Gainesway Stable (Antony Beck) and Peachtree Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bump brk,husted to lead,pace 2p,gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Meshell
ENTRY.OWNER: Knapczyk Andrew and Arnold Douglas S
ENTRY.COMMENT: lost footing,light bump st,sneaked to pocket 1/2,faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Diamond Earring
ENTRY.COMMENT: between foes on turn,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Jubilant Vision
ENTRY.COMMENT: taken back,draft bit 3p,tip 4p 5/16,shoulder to shoulder,won bob

ENTRY.NAME: Elraazy
ENTRY.COMMENT: perched 3w,let out upper, shoulder to shoulder w/winner,lost bob

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 3 1 1/16M Turf CR: 99. Allowance Purse 90000. (UP TO $17,000 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $10,000 ONCE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Cla iming, Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2015 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Other Than Claiming, Or Starter At Any Distance In 2015 Allowed 4 lbs. (Non-Starters for a claiming price of $25,000 or less in the last 3 starts preferred). (If the Stewards consider it i nadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile and One Sixteenth on the main track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BIGGER PICTURE steadied lightly at the start as DUJAC broke inwards taking over the lane, settled three wide near the rear patiently handled, came under light coaxing with five-sixteenths to go and angled six to seven wide into upper stretch, had ROCK EAGLE attempt to nudge his was out at that juncture and stood his ground denying the move, closed well on the outside through the final furlong and just got the bob on the wire. ADIRONDACK DANCER tracked the pace along the inside behind cover, got put to coaxing swinging three to four wide for home remaining in behind foes, found a seam as CHARITABLE drifted slightly weakening and was roused to split foes nearing the eighth pole, seized command inside that station digging in under threat from a quartet stubbornly but lost the nod on the wire. ENGLISH MINISTER attended the pace just off the inside early before advancing to race between foes coming under coaxing with five-sixteenths to run, swung four wide for home and took over narrowly straightened away, dug in under a drive under threat from a host a furlong out, got displaced inside that station, fought on to the wire drifting out slightly a bit in the last jumps while along for the show honors. DUJAC broke in at the start taking over the lane of BIGGER PICTURE and forcing that one to be taken in hand briefly, settled three to four wide in mid pack, got set down swinging six wide into upper stretch, rallied mildly keeping on to the wire then was steadied and altered in the last jumps when nudged as ENGLISH MINISTER drifted into HEAT FLASH. HEAT FLASH broke out at the start and was corrected, raced three wide in close aim coming under urging with five-sixteenths to run, angled five wide into upper stretch, ran on through the stretch fighting on between foes but was outkicked before shying a bit late from the drifting ENGLISH MINISTER albeit to late to impact the outcome. ROCK EAGLE broke in at the start putting himself nearly behind HEAT FLASH, settled two to three wide in mid pack, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled to the five path at the head of the stretch attempting to nudge his way out at the expense of BIGGER PICTURE and was denied the move, took to the four path straightened away and made no late headway on the front while improving position late on. IN SPEIGHT OFITALL three wide near the rear, tucked to the inside with nine-sixteenths to go, got roused swinging just off the inside for home, offered up a mild kick to the eighth pole before flattening out in the late stages. CHARITABLE established the front and showed the way in hand along the inside, came under urging at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide for home and yielded the front straightened away, then weakened to the wire.

ENTRY.NAME: In Speight Ofitall
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w near rear, to ins 9/16, roused 2w 1/4, mild bid, flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: Heat Flash
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out st, 3w in close aim, urged 5/16, 5w upper, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Rock Eagle
ENTRY.OWNER: Young Joyce B McManis Gerald Keltner Ken and Jones John
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in st, 2-3w mid pack, angled 4-5w 1/4p, no late headway

ENTRY.NAME: Charitable
ENTRY.COMMENT: on pace in hand ins, urged 5/16, 3w upper, headed, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Adirondack Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked ins, 3-4w uppr, split foes 1/8, led to near fin, lost nod

ENTRY.NAME: English Minister
ENTRY.COMMENT: attended betw 2p, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, led, fought on

ENTRY.NAME: Bigger Picture
ENTRY.COMMENT: steady st,3w near rear, roused 6-7w uppr, gd finish, got the bob

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Kenneth L. Ramsey & Sarah K. Ramsey

ENTRY.NAME: Dujac
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in st, 3-4w mid pack, set down 6w 1/4, kept on, steady late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 110. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 102000. (UP TO $21,000 NYSBFOA) FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $10,000 THREE TIMES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2015 OR CLAIMING PRICE $100,000. Weight, 1 24 lbs. Non-winners Of $60,000 At A Mile Or Over In 2014-2015 Allowed 3 lbs. Non-winners of two races other than Claiming, or Starter at a mile or over in 2015 Allowed 5 lbs. One such race in 2015 Allowed 8 lbs. Claiming Price $100,000 (Allowance Horses P referred)(Non-starters For A Claiming Price Of $25,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MATROOH was bumped from both sides at the break, partnered up with SAMRAAT as they edged away from others, raced as a team with that foe three wide, had the runner up join the fracas a few strides before arriving at the quarter pole, was set down, got engaged in an one on one battle with CATHOLIC COWBOY the rest of the way home, staved that rival off to prove best. CATHOLIC COWBOY was bumped at the start, raced from off the inside throughout, got let out a notch angling into the three path after entering the turn, closed in on the front runners, hitching up to them shortly before reaching the quarter pole, was turned loose, dueled with the winner the entire length of the stretch, got denied. WEALTH TO ME the only member of the quintent totally unscathced as the field was sent on its way, was sluggish, underwent a ground-saving journey and was along for the show. SAMRAAT squeezed at the break, was hand urged to gain a share of the top, sparred from the two path with the winner for a bit over three-quarters, was put to stronger encouragement prior to cutting the corner into the lane, fell back. MAIL came inward enough to make some contact with the top one at the start, sat reserved in the two path, came up empty in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Wealth to Me
ENTRY.OWNER: Drawing Away Stable and Jacobson, David
ENTRY.COMMENT: unscathed brk,sluggish,ground-saving journey, along for show

ENTRY.NAME: Catholic Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump brk,angle to 3p top turn,outside duo 1/4,dueled lane,denied

ENTRY.NAME: Samraat
ENTRY.COMMENT: squeeze brk,dueled 2p for 6f,gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Matrooh
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump btwn brk,spar 3p turn,btwen 1/4-upper,2nd duel,game

ENTRY.NAME: Mail
ENTRY.OWNER: Warren, Jr., Mr. and Mrs. William K.
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, reserved 2p, no response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 5 7F Turf CR: 110. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 96000. (UP TO $17,280 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $10,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $62,500. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winn ers Of Two Races Other Than Claiming, Or Starter In 2015 Allowed 2 lbs. One Such Race In 2015 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(Non-Starters for a claiming price of $25,000 or less in the last 3 starts preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Seven Furlongs on the main track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: READY FOR RYE established the front shortly after the start and showed the way through swift fractions just off the inside, came under coaxing as the field advanced to issue challenges with five-sixteenths remaining, spun just off the inside for home and took to the fence straightened away roused for the drive, shook away to the eighth pole and held clear to the wire to prevail. BARREL OF LOVE three wide near the rear early on, took to the rail nearing the midway point on the turn, got roused cutting the corner into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick to finish well for the place honors. LOS BORRACHOS four wide at the rear initially, came under urging stacked out in the overland route three furlongs from home, advanced through the latter portion of the turn on the front under a ride, swung six wide into upper stretch giving some of the headway back, then kicked on belatedly to procure the show honors in a good effort. BRICKYARD KITTEN five to six wide in mid pack down the backside, tucked in a path into the turn and was stacked four wide three furlongs out when put to coaxing, continued four wide into upper stretch, kept on through the drive but was outfinished. ZANDAR four to five wide in mid pack initially, tucked to the two path with nine-sixteenths to run before taking to hedge midway on the turn, got set down spinning just off the inside for home in behind the leader, ran on to the eighth pole between foes before weakening in the late stages. DEPECHE CHAT three to four wide near the rear, came under encouragement three furlongs out, spun four wide for home and passed tired foes in the lane. CABO CAT tracked the pace just off the inside from mid pack, tucked to the hedge with seven-sixteenths to go, came under urging midway on the turn, angled four wide into upper stretch and offered no response. BAD HOMBRE six wide early on, tucked to the three path with seven-sixteenths to go, came under a ride at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide for home and made no impact. THOMAS HILL inside early on, eased back front engaging READY FOR RYE and took to the three path to track in closest range, chased two to three wide through the turn put to encouragement with five-sixteenths to go, spun three wide for home and tired. SEAGATE just off the pace in pursuit four then three wide, got coaxed along with three furlongs to run, cornered three wide into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Seagate
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace 4-3w, coaxed along 3/8, 3w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Cabo Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, to hedge 7/16, urged 3/8, 4w upper, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Thomas Hill
ENTRY.OWNER: Epona Racing Stable and CJC Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside early, 2-3w in range, asked 5/16, 3w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Zandar
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-5w midpack, to 2p 9/16, hedge 3/8, 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Barrel of Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w near rear, to inside 3/8, cut corner roused, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Ready for Rye
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand on pace 2p, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, shook away, held clear

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Soc. Agr. Santa Elena De ChimbarongoLTDA

ENTRY.NAME: Depeche Chat
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-4w near rear, urged 3/8, 4w upper, by tired foes

ENTRY.NAME: Bad Hombre
ENTRY.COMMENT: 6w early, tucked 3p 7/16, urged 5/16, 5w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Los Borrachos
ENTRY.OWNER: Brous Stable LLC and Wachtel Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w at rear, urged overland 3/8, advanced, 6w upper, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Brickyard Kitten
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5-6w mid pack, stacked 4w 3/8, 4w upper, kept on, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Victory Ride S. - Grade3 BELMONT PARK RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 103. Stakes Purse 150000. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. By subscription of $150 each which should accompany the nomination; $750 to pass the entry box and an additional $750 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $2,250 along with the entry and sta rting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided $87,000 to the winner, $30,000 to second, $15,000 to third, $7,500 to fourth, $4,500 to fifth, $3,000 to sixth and $3,000 divided equally amongst the remaining fin ishers. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners of $120,000 or $60,000 twice allowed 2 lbs.; of $90,000 in 2015 allowed 4 lbs.; of $60,000 allowed 6 lbs.,of two races other than maiden, claiming or starter in 2015 allowed 8 lbs; of such a race in 2015 allowed 10 lb s. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, June 20, 2015 with 21 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IRISH JASPER came away in good order, picked up the pace noticeably coming to the end of the backstretch, got angled into the four path early on the turn and unleashed a bold, sustained run to loom a threat as the field prepared to enter into the stretch, maintained the momentum after settling into upper stretch, took charge during the next furlong, extended the margin kept to some encouragement to the end. ENCHANTING LADY took up the chase from the two path on the turn, swung five wide into the stretch, kicked into her best stride with under a furlong to go, displaying strong, but late foot en route to garnering the place. KATHBALLU disputed the pace from between rivlas on the turn, gotg placed three wide at the top of the lane and got outfinished. MISS ELLA had the rider grab hold after breaking slightly to the outside, left the backstretch from the three path, stalked a pair of foes to her inside on the turn, kept up the pursuit until the furlong grounds before giving way. PROMISE ME SILVER took the inside route, was under a firm hold for much of the initial half, appearing keen at times, found enough room to ease into the two path past the five-sixteenths pole just as the former pacesetter, that being SUPER SAKS, was at the beginning of her oncoming retreat, was caught behind rivals at the quarter pole, espied an opening along the inside corridor turning for home, dove for it, got taken hold of in the vicinity of the sixteenth pole when caught in tight for a few jumps, cleared too late to make any impact. SUPER SAKS broke on top and maintained the advantage, cut over to the inside, was forced to fend off a pair of opponents placed in paths two and three respectively on the turn, yielded shortly after completing the half then steadily backed away.

ENTRY.NAME: Promise Me Silver
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins,slip 2p 1/4 (traffic),.alter ins,tight near 1/16,no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Enchanting Lady
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p turn,swung 5w into upper,late foot for place

ENTRY.NAME: Super Saks
ENTRY.OWNER: Baker, Robert C. and Mack, William L.
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace inside,faced off against duo turn, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Kathballu
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied btwn foes, 3w top of lane,outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Irish Jasper
ENTRY.COMMENT: pick up pace 1/2,bold 4w run turn,took charge, drew off

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Mr. & Mrs. Robert E. Courtney Sr.

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Ella
ENTRY.COMMENT: out bit break,stalked pair 3w,factor to furlong grounds, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Dwyer S. - Grade3 BELMONT PARK RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 105. Stakes Purse 500000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS. By subscription of $500 each which should accompany the nomination; $3,000 to pass the entry box and an additional $4,500 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $7,500 along with the entry and starti ng fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries.The guaranteed purse of $500,000 will be divided accordingly, $275,000 to the owner of the winner, $100,000 to second, $60,000 to third, $30,000 to fourth, $15,000 to fifth, $10,000 to sixtha nd remaining $10,000 to be divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 123 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded Sweepstake at a mile or over allowed 2 lbs.; of a Sweepstake at a mile or over, 4 lbs.; of two races other than maiden, claiming or startee r in 2015, 6 lbs.; of such a race in 2015, 8 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, June 20, 2015 with 30 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPEIGHTSTER a bit eager under a light hold forwardly placed three then two wide prompting the leader a bit through legitimate splits, took over nearing the quarter pole and cleared that rival to cut the corner roused into upper stretch, edged away under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in and held sway to the wire. TEXAS RED bumped lightly at the start by TOMMY MACHO due to BRIDGET'S BIG LUVY recovering outwards from a bobble, raced four to five wide in pursuit from near the rear, came under coaxing nearing the five-sixteenths and advanced on the front before swinging five wide for home, drifted in under an off sided stick straightened away and was corrected, ran on to chase the winner home. TOMMY MACHO bumped at the start by BRIDGET'S BIG LUVY who recovered outwards after bobbling slightly, raced three wide in range of the front, came under coaxing with seven-sixteenths to go, cornered three wide into upper stretch, weakened in the late stages. SMART TRANSITION five wide early on, shifted to be two to three wide at the rear, came under urging with three furlongs to run, angled five wide into upper stretch, passed tired rivals in the stretch. BLOFELD coaxed from the start, tracked the pace along the inside under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, angled three wide at the quarter pole and tired. HOLLYWOOD ANGEL hustled from the start, crossed to show the way along the inside under some pressure from SPEIGHTSTER to the outside, came under coaxing with three furlongs to run, got headed nearing the quarter pole, cut the corner into upper stretch and faltered. BRIDGET'S BIG LUVY a bit fractious prior to the start, bobbled slightly at the break and recovered to bump TOMMY MACHO into TEXAS RED, chased just off the inside just off the pace, got put to encouragement with three furlongs remaining, angled four wide for home and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Blofeld
ENTRY.OWNER: Glencrest Farm LLC (Lessee) and JSM Equine LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, tracked inside, coaxed 7/16, 3w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Bridget's Big Luvy
ENTRY.COMMENT: slight bobble st, 2p just off pace, coaxed 3/8, 4w uppr, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Tommy Macho
ENTRY.OWNER: Pompa Jr Paul P and All American Horses LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, 3w in range, coaxed 7/16, 3w upper, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Red
ENTRY.OWNER: Brehm Erich Detmar Wayne Michaels Lee Desormeaux J Keith et al
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bump st, 4-5w pursuit, urged 5/16, 5w upper, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Hollywood Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, cut pace ins, coaxed 3/8, headed near 1/4, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Speightster
ENTRY.COMMENT: eager in aim 3-2w, up near 1/4, cut corner, edged away, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Smart Transition
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w at rear, urged 3/8, angled 5w upper, passed tired rivals

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Belmont Derby Invitational S. - Grade1 BELMONT PARK RACE 8 1 1/4M Inner turf CR: 108. Stakes Purse 1250000. INNER TURF AN INVITATIONAL FOR NORTHERN HEMISPHERE AND SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE. (Australian, New Zealand and South African; Foaled after August 1, 2011 and before July 31, 2012) THREE-YEAR-OLDS. In order to be eligible for entry into the Belmont Derby Invita tional, horses accepting the invitation must make a pre-entry payment of $8,750 (US) no later than 1:00 PM (EDT) on Wednesday, June 24th. An entry fee of $10,000 (US) will be due at time of entry (Fees are payable to the New York Racing Association, Inc.) The purse for the Belmont Derby Invitational shall be divided as follows: $670,000 to the owner of the winner, $230,000 to second, $125,000 to third, $85,000 to fourth, $50,000 to fifth, $35,000 to sixth, $30,000 to seventh and $25,000 to eighth. Weights : Northern Hemisphere Colts and Geldings 122 lbs. Fillies 119 lbs. Southern Hemisphere* Colts and Gledings 126 lbs. Fillies123 lbs. Trophies will be presented to the winning owner, trainer and jockey. The Belmont Derby Invitational field will be limited t
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FORCE THE PASS quickly tucked along the rail, sat forwardly placed keeping wach on the pacesetter, was given his cue and issued a successful bid to take over midway on the far turn, edged away the rest of the way to the quarter pole to lead the field into the stretch with none latched on, responded well when given his cue to steadily lengthen away down the lane, briskly ridden to the end. CANNDAL (FR) was rank on the bit for a portion of the way along the homestretch, settled down getting placed along the inside route prior to reaching the clubhouse turn, continued to remain unhurried, glued to the hedge, both on the backstretch and the second bend, got roused cutting corner into the stretch, failed to match the winner's speed and had to settle for place honors. STARTUP NATION secured a prominent dpot start after the start, had the rider take hold as GRANNY'S KITTEN was working out a tuck himself closer to the inside, raced from off the inside throughout, departed the backstretch placed in the four path, quickened when asked in the vicinity of the five-sixteenths marker, swung one path wider into the stretch, rallied willingly enough to take the show. CLOSING BELL appeared unsettled racing between rivals in the early stages, cut over to the inside, scurrred into contention with a run from upper to midstretch, flattened out in the final furlong. TAKEOVER TARGET reserved along the inside early, slipped into the two path heading down the backstretch, raced between rivals for a portion of the run around the far turn, commenced the stretch four wide, lacked the needed response. POSTULATION travelled three wide to the five-sixteenths pole, angled outwad until in the five path a furlong later, made no significant headway after finishing the move. DIVISIDERO in the two path, was parked out on the overland route on the far turn, fanned even wider during the initial portion of the stretch, was moving well late. GRANNY'S KITTEN rated stalking the leader from the three path, gave way. BOLO cut the pace from the two path, attended by GRANNY'S KITTEN to the outside, got overtaken by the winner at the three-eighths pole, retreated then was vanned off after crossing the wire.

ENTRY.NAME: Takeover Target
ENTRY.OWNER: Klaravich Stables, Inc. and Lawrence, William H.
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved ins early,slip 2p back,btwen 2nd,4w upper,mild

ENTRY.NAME: Bolo
ENTRY.OWNER: Golden Pegasus Racing and Earle I Mack LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace 2p,overtaken 3/8,retreated, vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Divisidero
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p early,overland 2nd,moving well late

ENTRY.NAME: Canndal (FR)

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of CMP

ENTRY.COMMENT: rank on bit early,saved ground,cut corner, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Force the Pass
ENTRY.COMMENT: rate ins,bid 3/8 to lead,set down 1/4,kicked away,kept busy

ENTRY.NAME: Closing Bell
ENTRY.COMMENT: unsettled btwn early,inside journey,bid 1/4-1/8,.flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Postulation

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of CUR

ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w to 5/16,angle 5p from 5/16-3/16,no headway

ENTRY.NAME: Startup Nation
ENTRY.OWNER: Klaravich Stables, Inc. and Lawrence, William H.
ENTRY.COMMENT: took hold early,off ins,4w 1/2,quickened 5/16,5w into,rally show

ENTRY.NAME: Granny's Kitten
ENTRY.OWNER: Ramsey, Kenneth L. and Sarah K.
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated stalking 3w, gave way

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Suburban H. - Grade2 BELMONT PARK RACE 9 1 1/4M Dirt CR: 122. Stakes Purse 500000. A HANDICAP FOR FOUR- YEAR- OLDS AND UPWARD. By subscription of $500 each which should accompany the nomination; $3,000 to pass the entry box and an additional $4,500 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $7,500 (along wi th the entry and starting fees) must be made before 11:00 AM Saturday June 27th. The guaranteed purse will be divided accordingly, $275,000 to the owner of the winner, $100,000 to second, $60,000 to third, $30,000 to fourth, $15,000 to fifth, $10,000 tos ixth and the remaining $10,000 divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Trophies will be presented to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, June 20, 2015 with 18 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EFFINEX allowed to settle saving ground as the field strung out early on, advanced in tandem with the rest with five furlongs to go as the duelers caught a breather steadying briefly with nine-sixteenths to go off the heels of STREET BABE, came under coaxing just past the five-sixteenths just off the inside and swung three wide for home, rallied steadily wearing down the leader in the final eighth joined to the outside by TONALIST, dug in seizing command inside the sixteenth marker knocking heads to the end and denied that foe on the wire in game fashion. TONALIST four wide early on, took to the three path with six furlongs to go briefly before the field advanced in tandem on the duelers with a rush five furlongs out, shifted his way back to the four path nudging MYLUTE five wide at that station, raced four wide in the turn patiently handled until nearing the quarter pole, got roused four wide into upper stretch, rallied outside a pair to get latched on nearing the sixteenth marker fighting head to head through to the finish with EFFINEX but was ultimately denied in a good effort. COACH INGE dueled from the three path with STREET BABE to his inside spurting away from the rest in tandem through the first turn into the backside, took a collective breather with his pace rival through the latter portion of the backside and had the field advance quickly with five furlongs remaining, shook off STREET BABE with half a mile to go and tucked to the two path put to a light coaxing, spun just off the inside for home roused into upper stretch, dug in holding well and stubborn under challenge through the final eighth, got caught just inside the sixteenth marker and was along well clear for the show honors. NECK 'N NECK four wide early on, tucked to the three path three furlongs from home and gradually continued inside to spin just off the inside into upper stretch let out for the drive, then tired in the lane. MYLUTE chased the pace four wide, got nudged five wide with nine-sixteenths to go as TONALIST made some room after the field advanced on the duelers, came under coaxing three furlongs from home, spun three wide into upper stretch and faltered. STREET BABE gape dueled with COACH INGE to his outside through a swift opening quarter before taking a breather in tandem with his main rival through the latter portion of the backside, had the field advanced and came under coaxing at the nine-sixteenths, got shaken off into the far turn and retreated steadily thereafter.

ENTRY.NAME: Street Babe
ENTRY.COMMENT: gap dueled 2p, coaxed 9/16, retreated after three-quarters

ENTRY.NAME: Coach Inge
ENTRY.COMMENT: gap dueled 3p, to 2p 7/16, roused 2w 1/4, dug in stubborn, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Mylute
ENTRY.OWNER: GoldMark Farm, LLC and Whisper Hill Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4w, nudged 5w 9/16, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Neck 'n Neck
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w pursuit, to 3p 3/8, set down 2w 1/4p, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Effinex
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle saving grd, urged 5/16, 3w upper, dug in gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Tonalist
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4p to 3p 3/4p, nudged way to 4p 9/16, 4w upper, rallied, denied

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Belmont Oaks Invitational S. - Grade1 BELMONT PARK RACE 10 1 1/4M Inner turf CR: 109. Stakes Purse 1000000. INNER TURF AN INVITATIONAL FOR NORTHERN HEMISPHERE AND SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LADY ELI took up in position in midpack from off the inside, departed the backstretch from the four path, tipped a bit wider and unleashed a strong run from the five-sixteenths pole, turned for home with good momentum, powered her way to the front during the run through the furlong grounds, extended the margin maintaining her impressive kick to the end. ITSONLYACTINGDAD vacated the inside route heading for the end of the backstretch, picked up the pace fanning outward into the stretch, wound up towards the six path by the conclusion of the maneunver, came home with good energy to procure the place. OUTSTANDING (IRE) raced in midpack placed in the two path, was between rivals on the far turn, was set down angling three wide into the stretch, finished willingly enough to earn the show. SENTIERO ITALIA off the inside throughout, was hung out in the four path on the far turn, held on well to tie with STRICT COMPLIANCE for the last major award. STRICT COMPLIANCE got away sluggishly, was mostly two wide to the half mile pole, took one path wider on the second bend, got guided towards the middle of the course from upper to midstretch until eight wide, closed in well once straightened away. CONSUMER CREDIT was in the two path between opponents on the far turn, moved out into the seven path during the opening phase of the stretch run, lacked the needed late response. SHARLA RAE off the inside, made no impact. MISS CHATELAINE outrun early, improved position in a non-threatening manner. PINE NEEDLES broke alertly, yielded to LADY ZUZU on the first turn, was placed into two path afterwards, stalked the new leader, made a successful challenge approaching the quarter pole to lead a revved-up herd into the lane, proved powerless when confronted by the winner in midlane, backed away steadily after relinquishing. SPANISH QUEEN faltered off a ground-saving trip. OLORDA (GER) along the inside, tired. LADY ZUZU cleared to the lead and over to the rail nearing the end of the first turn, briefly spurted off from the competition, came under pressure from PINE NEEDLES, yielded to that foe late on the far turn and tired. DARING DUCHESS forwardly placed three wide, folded. GYPSY JUDY took up the chase from the two path, checked when done at the quarter pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Pine Needles
ENTRY.COMMENT: sharp start, to 2p top back,prompt,bid 1/4,overpowered 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Eli
ENTRY.COMMENT: off ins,unhurried,4w 2nd,swung 5w into full of run,strong kick

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Runnymede Farm Inc. & Catesby W. Clay

ENTRY.NAME: Sharla Rae
ENTRY.OWNER: Brous Stable LLC Barber Gary and Wachtel Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: off inside, made no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Itsonlyactingdad
ENTRY.COMMENT: left inside 1/2,fanned 6w into lane, good kick

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Chatelaine
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun early, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Spanish Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Consumer Credit
ENTRY.OWNER: Brous Stable LLC Barber Gary and Wachtel Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p & btwn foes turn, angled to 7p upper, no late response

ENTRY.NAME: Olorda (GER)

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of LCH

ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Gypsy Judy
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p,checked when done at 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Outstanding (IRE)

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of NAA

ENTRY.OWNER: Magnier, Mrs. John, Tabor, Michael and Smith, Derrick
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p,between rivals 2nd,urged 3w into upper,got the show

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Sentiero Italia
ENTRY.COMMENT: off inside, 4w 2nd turn, held well for share of fourth

ENTRY.NAME: Daring Duchess
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed 3w,folded

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Zuzu
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear to lead & ins 1st,brief spurt,collared near 1/4,tired

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Strict Compliance
ENTRY.OWNER: Klaravich Stables, Inc. and Lawrence, William H.
ENTRY.COMMENT: sluggish break,most 2p to 1/2,3w top 2nd,guided 8p 3/16,closed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Belmont Sprint Championship S. - Grade3 BELMONT PARK RACE 11 7F Dirt CR: 111. Stakes Purse 400000. FOR THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. By subscription of $400 each which should accompany the nomination; $2,000 to pass the entry box and an additional $2,000 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $6,000 along with the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The guaranteed purse to be divided accordingly, $220,000 to the owner of the winner, $80,000 to second, $48,000 to third, $24,000 to fourth, $12,000 to fifth, $8,000 to sixth with the remaining $8,000 to be divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Three year olds, 119 lbs. Older 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Grade One in 2014-15 allowed 2 lbs.; of a Grade Two in 2014-15 allowed, 4 lbs.; of a Grade Three race in 2014-15 allowed 6 lbs.; of two races other than maiden, claiming, starter or state bred in 2015 allowed 8 lbs.; such a race since than, 10 lbs. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, June 20, 2015 with 23 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRIVATE ZONE a bit eager on the pace under a hold three wide, tucked to the two path into the turn and was given a notch and shook away through the bend, spun just off the inside for home roused for the drive and held clear to prevail. CLEARLY NOW chased just off the inside, came under encouragement with five-sixteenths to go, swung three wide for home, offered up a mild kick for the place honors. STALLWALKIN' DUDE chased the pace four then three wide through the turn, came under encouragement nearing the quarter pole, swung four wide at that station, offered up a mild bid before weakening in the late stages. GREEN GRATTO bobbled slightly at the start, chased three wide in close aim, came under urging three furlongs out, soon after PRIVATE ZONE slipped away, cornered three wide for home and tired. C. ZEE chased the pace four to five wide under a ride from three furlongs out and tired in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Private Zone
ENTRY.COMMENT: bit eager on pace 3p, to 2p 1/2p, shook away, 2w 1/4p, held clear

ENTRY.NAME: Green Gratto
ENTRY.OWNER: Grant, Gaston and Anthony and Greene, Basil
ENTRY.COMMENT: slight bobble st, 3w in close aim, urged 3/8, 3w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Clearly Now
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, asked 5/16, 3w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Stallwalkin' Dude
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4-3w, urged nearing 1/4p, 4w upper, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: C. Zee
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5-4w, urged 3/8, 5w upper, tired
